[blockly](./blockly.md) &gt; [Field](./blockly.field_class.md) &gt; [(constructor)](./blockly.field_class._constructor__1_constructor.md)

## Field.(constructor)

Constructs a new instance of the `Field` class

**Signature:**

```typescript
constructor(value: T | typeof Field.SKIP_SETUP, validator?: FieldValidator<T> | null, config?: FieldConfig);
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  value | T \| typeof [Field.SKIP\_SETUP](./blockly.field_class.skip_setup_property.md) | The initial value of the field. Also accepts Field.SKIP\_SETUP if you wish to skip setup (only used by subclasses that want to handle configuration and setting the field value after their own constructors have run). |
|  validator | [FieldValidator](./blockly.fieldvalidator_typealias.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt; \| null | _(Optional)_ A function that is called to validate changes to the field's value. Takes in a value &amp; returns a validated value, or null to abort the change. |
|  config | [FieldConfig](./blockly.fieldconfig_interface.md) | _(Optional)_ A map of options used to configure the field. Refer to the individual field's documentation for a list of properties this parameter supports. |
